intro: Tibouchina velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Tibouchina velutina is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
